Event.name: Counterattack
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Assailant</fen> physically attacks a <fen>Victim</fen> (which is usually but not always sentient), causing or intending to cause the <fen>Victim</fen> physical damage. The attack is a response to an earlier attack by the <fen>Victim</fen> on the current <fen>Assailant</fen> (or by actors associated with the <fen>Assailant</fen> or <fen>Victim</fen>).
A <fen>Weapon</fen> used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> may also be mentioned, in addition to the usual <fen>Place</fen>, <fen>Time</fen>, <fen>Purpose</fen>, <fen>Reason</fen>, etc. Sometimes a location is used metonymically to stand for the <fen>Assailant</fen> or the <fen>Victim</fen>, and in such cases the <fen>Place</fen> FE will be annotated on a second FE layer.
<ex>Are <fex name="Asl">we</fex> <t>counterattacking</t> <fex name="Victim">them</fex> <fex name="Purp">just to keep them off balance</fex>?</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Victim
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is the being or entity that is injured by the <fen>Assailant</fen>'s attack.
<ex>US troops<t>counterattacked</t> <fex name="Victim">the French</fex> the next day.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Weapon
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An entity used by the <fen>Assailant</fen> to cause damage to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>The mysterious fighter <t>counterattacked</t> <fex name="Weapon">with a sabre</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Assailant
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The person (or other self-directed entity) that is responding to a prior attack by attempting physical harm to the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Assailant">The mysterious fighter</fex> <t>counterattacked</t> the guardsmen with a sabre.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition: <def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (probably, presumably, mysteriously), force (hard, softly), secondary effects (quietly, loudly), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may also indicate salient characteristics of an <fen>Assailant</fen> that also affect the action (presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully). </def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition:
<def-root>An intentional action performed by the <fen>Assailant</fen> that accomplishes the assault.
<ex><fex name="Assailant">Japanese</fex> <t>counterattacked</t> <fex name="Means">by invading coastal fortifications</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the place where the <fen>Assailant</fen> makes an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>Then they staged a <t>counterattack</t><fex name="Place">on our left flank</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Purpose
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the purpose for which an <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex>Hostile troops probably <m>launched</m> a <t>counteroffensive</t> <fex name="Purpose">to try to intimidate us</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>A state of affairs that the <fen>Assailant</fen> is responding to that leads them to make an assault on the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Assailant">We</fex> <t>counterattack</t> <fex name="Explanation">because if we don't, we'll be an easier target next time</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the time when the <fen>Assailant</fen> attacks the <fen>Victim</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Time">The previous day's</fex> <t>counterattack</t> <fex name="Victim">on French troops</fex> was deemed a success.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Source
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The starting-point of the motion of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or projectiles of the <fen>Assailant</fen> as they move toward the the <fen>Place</fen> that the <fen>Victim</fen> is occupying in the attack. In prepositional phrases, the prepositional object expresses the starting point of motion. With particles, the starting point of motion is understood from context.
<ex>We'll <t>counterattack</t> <fex name="Src">from our current position</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Depictive
Arg.definition:
<def-root>This FE is used for any <fen>Depictive</fen> phrase describeing the state of the <fen>Assailant</fen> or <fen>Victim</fen> while the Attack occurs.
<ex>They <t>counterattacked</t> us <fex name="Depictive">in large numbers</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Re-encoding
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE presents the current frame as an integral part of a larger conceptualization expressed by another frame. The frame expressed by the target typically corresponds to a Means action within the frame expressed by the <fex name="Re-encoding">Re-encoding</fex>, but not necessarily. </def-root>

Arg.name: Result
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Result</fen> of the attack on the <fen>Victim</fen> by the <fen>Assailant</fen>. </def-root>

Arg.name: Containing_event
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE denotes an event that occurs or state of affairs that holds at a time that includes the time during which the event or state of affairs reported by the target occurs and of which it is taken to be a part.</def-root>

Arg.name: Particular_iteration
Arg.definition: <def-root>Expressions marked with this extra-thematic FE modify a non-iterative use of the target, and indicate that it is conceived as embedded within an iterated series of similar events or states. In addition, most expressions of Particular_iteration indicate which instance of the series is being referred to.</def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>Circumstances describe the state of the world (at a particular time and place) which is specifically independent of the event itself and any of its participants. </def-root>

Arg.name: Iterations
Arg.definition: <def-root>The frame element <fex name="Iterations">Iterations</fex> is used for expressions that indicate the number of times an event or state (of the kind denoted by the target in its clause) has taken place or held. Examples include <m>once</m>, <m>twice</m>, [Cardinal expression] + <m>times</m>, <m>a lot</m>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Event_description
Arg.definition: <def-root>In general, this FE is used for phrases that describe the clause of the target as a whole. There are two somewhat distinct subgroups of sentence modifiers that cover this function.</def-root>

Arg.name: Path
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Path</fen> refers to (a part of) the ground over which the <fen>Assailant</fen> travels. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: counter-attack.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: an attack in response to a prior attack.

lexUnit.name: counter-attack.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to attack another in response to their attack.

lexUnit.name: counter-offensive.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a large-scale assault in response to offensive moves made by an opponent.
